Key Match Events: Mark Wood and Liam Livingstone took three wickets apiece as England battled back in their T20 World Cup clash with Ireland
Adil Rashid deflected Balbirnie’s drive on to the stumps at the non-striker’s end to run-out Lorcan Tucker for 34
Livingstone claimed two dismissals in two balls
Livingstone finished with an international best three for 17
Sam Curran bowled both Barry McCarthy and Fionn Hand as Ireland imploded in their first competitive match at the MCG
Miscellaneous Highlights: England were under the pump as Ireland raced to 59 for one from the powerplay then reached 100 in the 12th over
England came back into it in the second half of Ireland’s innings and face a smaller chase than they might initially have envisaged
Others: Chris Woakes conceded 41 from three overs, while Curran also went at more than 10 an over
